title: Southport player targeted by pitch invader during win over Stockport County
description: A Southport player was targeted by a fan who ran onto the field during their recent 3-1 victory over Stockport County.
content: A supporter was able to get onto the field at Haig Avenue and get within reach of the Southport substitutes, warming up on the touchline.Reports from the stadium claimed the spectator had approached a Southport player and aimed a kick in his direction, before police and officials from both dugouts quickly acted to bring the situation under control.Southport had acknowledged a "serious issue" had taken place during the game and have since confirmed that an investigation is underway to ascertain what happened.CCTV footage has been made available to police who attended the incident, while Merseyside Police have confirmed the player involved was not injured, and that a group of supporters were ejected from the ground following the event taking place.Southport have issued an official statement on their club website, outlining what happened."In the second half of today's game against Stockport County, a spectator encroached onto the field of play and attacked a Southport player who was warming up on the touchline at the time of the incident."Following the game, several club representatives spoke to the police and an investigation into the incident is now ongoing. Club officials have reviewed available CCTV and match footage, and multiple clear images of the incident are available to the police."The club takes the safety of our staff, our players, our volunteers and our supporters seriously. The club believes this was an isolated incident, however in light of today's events, a full review of safety procedures will be conducted," the statement concluded.
